Subjective: Body tension, stiff muscles. Rapid breathing, heart palpitations; worse during relaxation. Difficulty falling asleep, worrying thoughts. No chest pain, irregular heartbeat, dizziness. Works long hours, feels uncertain at work.
Objective: BP 120/60, HR 65, O2 sat 98%, RR 14. Lungs clear, no murmurs. No abdominal complaints.
Assessment: Stress-related symptoms, likely due to work demands. No physical causes found on exam.
Plan: 1. Blood test to rule out anemia, thyroid issues, liver and kidney function.
3. Build in relaxation moments, maintain regularity in life.
4. Consider occupational health doctor for work adjustments.
5. Follow up if symptoms worsen or have concerns.
